intro: Hilleria latifolia var. longifolia, commonly known as the long-leaved hilleria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its evergreen nature and showy flowers. The plant features broad, leathery leaves that are elongated, giving it its common name, while its clusters of small, fragrant white or pink flowers bloom throughout the year. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ability to thrive in humid, shaded environments.
